body.p:
Flemingsburg Ky
Novr 1st 1863
Governor Bramlette
Dear Sir
Capt Wm E Rice who served as a Captain in the 10th Ky Cavalry desires a Commission as Col of the Troops proposed to be raised for state defence under your late Proclamation.
Captain Rice is a citizen of this County and acquired direction for his galantry he was popular as an officer with his men and has been represented to me as a fine Disciplinarian

When the appointment is to be made it would be gratifying to many of
your friends in this county if you would confer the appointment on him. I am informed that such is the desire of citizens of Bath County as for as expressed among whom Capt Rice is well known and where as an officer much of his Service was reward

Verry Respectfully yours &c
Wm S Botts.
I am well acquainted with Capt Wm E. Rice He is a neighbour of mine -- I most cheerfully concur with Judge Botts and recomend him as worthy of a commission

Several of the lading Union men of Bath & Mtgomery wish me to be in command of the the forces raised for State defence which I will acept with commissioned to raise a full reg-: I belonged to the 10th Ky ^Cavalry^ about fourteen months and scouted all the eastern portion of the state and am very well acquainted ^with^ all portions of the state
